subject: RE: [junit] Do You Want to Skip Test Methods?
msgSnippet: Something like this would be helpful to me.  Usually I comment out the test until I remember to fix it.  This way I wouldn t have to remember to fix it, JUnit
messageBody:
Something like this would be helpful to me. Usually I comment out the
test until I remember to fix it. This way I wouldn't have to remember
to fix it, JUnit would tell me to fix it...

Kris

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Bill Venners [mailto:bv@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 24, 2003 4:55 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Do You Want to Skip Test Methods?
>
>
> Hello All,
>
> I'm curious how many JUnit users want a way to temporarily
> mark certain
> test methods so that the runner doesn't execute them, but
> reports that
> they are skipped. This is a functionality that Vladimir R. Bossicard
> provides via his JUnit Add-Ons runner, which he describes in
> his first
> blog post:
>
http://www.artima.com/weblogs/viewpost.jsp?thread=4603

I'm considering whether or not it makes sense to do something similar
for SuiteRunner, and I'd like to know what JUnit users would really
want. If you do want something like this, for what specific use cases
do you imagine you'd use it?

Thanks.

Bill
--
Bill Venners
Artima Software, Inc.
http://www.artima.com
